highlights.text: countries with difficulties purchasing effective anti-COVID-19 equipment    The Commission announced on Monday the procurement through the Emergency Support Instrument of 200 robots fordisinfecting hospitals in the EU. These robots will be sent to the Member States in the coming weeks. I would request that theCommission channel these robots primarily to Romania and the other EU countries finding it difficult to purchase effective antiCOVID19 equipment.    At the same time, I welcome the fact that the Commission

protective equipment and medicines and made advance purchase agreements for vaccines. A clearing house  8  was established tofacilitate the matching of Members States needs with the supply of medical equipment. ESI is also used for deploying disinfectionrobots in hospitals.    For the distribution of essential products, the Commission determines a quota for each Member State using data from the EuropeanCentre for Disease Prevention and Control. reality.    A central part of this report is the issue of liability. • BBC News, (2020), Coronavirus: Lufthansa agrees €9bn rescue deal with Germany, [Online]. Available at: https://www.bbc.com/news/business-52801131#:~:text=Lufthansa%20has% 20agreed%20a%20rescue,budget%20airline%20Germanwings%20in%20April.
• BBC News, (2020), Coronavirus: Air France set to cut more than 7,500 jobs, [Online]. Available at: https://www.bbc.com/news/business-53284789

Most governments prioritise air transport connectivity to prevent the additional loss of jobs and economic activity. However, not all airlines received governmental support, such as direct monetary support, loans and tax relief, creating a situation whereby certain airlines will survive and others will not. Among the airlines that have received monetary support are KLM (3.4 billion euros), Air France (7 billion euros), Lufthansa (9 billion euros), Iberia (10 billion euros), Tarom (19.3 million euros). Despite the financial support, several airlines have decided to make various job cuts before the end of 2020. Air France – KLM has reduced 7.500 of its jobs, Lufthansa plans to cut 22.000 jobs, Tarom will cut some 700 to 1.800 employees. https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0969699720304841https://nos.nl/artikel/2338574-steunpakket-klm-voor-3-4-miljard-banenverlies-onvermijdelijk.htmlhttps://www.rfi.fr/en/business/20201118-french-government-ready-to-fork-out-further-%E2%82%AC6bn-in-covid-relief-to-bail-out-air-france-klm-greenpeace-sues-carbon-emissionshttps://www.bbc.com/news/business-52801131#:%7E:text=Lufthansa%20has%20agreed%20a%20rescue,budget%20airline%20Germanwings%20in%20April.https://elpais.com/economia/2020-07-03/el-gobierno-inyectara-dinero-a-iberia-del-nuevo-fondo-para-empresas-estrategicas.html https://www.aerotime.aero/26082-romania-s-air-carrier-tarom-to-get-19-3-million-state-aid https://www.bbc.com/news/business-53284789 https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-53007048 https://www.romania-insider.com/tarom-staff-cuts-aug-2020

Madam President, black Friday is one of the biggest online shopping daysof the year, but workers say that they are treated like robots in the rush to get deliveries out tocustomers. That is why I joined demonstrators outside the Peterborough Amazon warehouse.Workers have told the GMB that they dont have enough time for toilet breaks, 87 are in paindue to their workload and they are

wait for themto arrive but for that to happen safely there needs to be enough well trained, well paid staff. highlights.text: there is great concern that people will not have enough jobsbecause robots will replace them. On the other hand, there is great concern about the lack ofskilled workers on the markets. Yet, in the future we shall need even more highly skilled people.The best evidence of this is that the countries with the highest number of robots per job, Germany,South Korea, Singapore, have the lowest unemployment rates. There are currently around151 robots per 10 000 working places in Slovakia. That is more than half the

title: WEDNESDAY, 7 FEBRUARY 2018

highlights.text: we know them arechanging, the labour market is changing and the typical permanent pensionable job is no longerthere for many. There is evidence of temporary, part-time working on a contract basis, flexiblelabour market and, of course, with automation, robots and globalisation, employment as weknow it is changing. title: Compte-rendu session Strasbourg 5 avril 2011

highlights.text: Barroso,parce que jai été interpelée par Areva, qui est allé auJapon, où son matériel a été interdit et stocké àlaéroport.
